column4: this would launch "command" in the background, ready for you to attach with screen -r if needed
that's the command I use to launch things in screen on reboot
you launch rtorrent on boot up with that too?
actually I do it from my user's crontab, with "@reboot /usr/bin/screen -dmS rtorrent /usr/bin/rtorrent"
anything launched from rc.local runs as root by default (I believe) which I didn't want or need
so the crontab would be just @reboot /usr/bin/screen -dmS rtorrent /usr/bin/rtorrent
yeah, I'm pretty sure that's all it says. I found I had to use full pathnames as the $PATH wasn't set, but that's not a problem really
ok, so I don't need the * * * * * before that correct?
no, you only need that for timed events. for starting things on reboot, just replace all the stars with the keyword @reboot
very nice, I didn't know that
me neither, for a long time...comes in very useful now though!
are there other @ commands that would work in a cron too?
I'm not sure, what other events do you have in mind?
dunno...just interested in that type of entry in a cron -- knowledge is power :)
I just needed to change that to /usr/local/bin/rtorrent -- that's where the svn version is installed -- thanks again
